PESEDJET.NAME: PESEDJET
PESEDJET.DESCRIPTION:
The Pesedjet, originating from Egypt, is the oldest (though not necessarily the wisest) of the pantheons. This family of Gods claims their origins date back more than 7,000 years, on the banks of the Nile River in northeast Africa, and has endured through cultural, mythical, and physical changes in the very fabric of the World. As a pantheon, the Pesedjet is concerned with ma’at — justice expressed through social order. For the Pesedjet, everyone must know their place, and every position must be filled by the right person. In the times before time, the Titans destroyed the proper relationships between people, and the Pesedjet created a social order in which people could live knowing their place in an established hierarchy. Today, Scions of the Pesedjet tend to be concerned with disruptions in social stability caused by the Titans' actions. Refugee movements, discontent caused by spiritual poverty and unemployment, revolutionary movements — these draw the attention of the Pesedjet as disturbances in the mythical realms.
Other divine tribes view the Pesedjet as backward and conservative but admit that the Egyptian Gods truly know how to impose lasting order on a chaotic world.
The Pesedjet's greatest weakness is its commitment to stability at any cost. The Egyptian Gods and their Scions prefer minimally disruptive solutions to problems, relying on old patterns to maintain the status quo.
Other Gods find this attitude frustrating. Old patterns allowed the Titans to break free in the first place; why perpetuate easily disrupted systems? Still, the Egyptian deities promote tradition and conservative attitudes as bulwarks against chaos, leaving united but reactionary societies in their wake.

DODEKATHEON.NAME: DODEKATHEON
DODEKATHEON.DESCRIPTION:
The second oldest of the divine tribes, the Dodekatheon comprises the Gods of Olympus from Greco-Roman legends. Their origins are obscure, as the ancient Greeks already knew their Gods when they migrated to the Mediterranean Sea about 4,000 years ago, but they were still changing and growing 2,500 years ago, and their forms only became fixed about 1,500 years ago.
Where the Pesedjet emphasizes social and cultural stability over and against individual rights, the Dodekatheon sought to impose patterns of individuality within the community on humanity. Arete — personal excellence in service to humanity — is the motivating drive of this tribe of Gods and their Scions. It is important for most people to know their place, but it is equally important for some to rise above their stations and create new standards for human life. In modern times, Scions of the Dodekatheon seek to manifest and awaken great spirits in society — such as artists, warriors, spiritual seekers, judges, leaders, and poets. Extraordinary individuals can strengthen the fabric of reality so that the Titans do not gain purchase on it or tear through the curtains of illusion.
Sometimes, the Scions of the Olympians challenge mortals, and sometimes, they are the mortals challenged by the Gods. Both routes lead to greatness — an exaltation of human effort that stops the Titans from destroying the World. The greatest weakness of the Greek pantheon is hubris — the belief that the individual is capable of overcoming Fate. Every God in the Dodekatheon believes that their most recent favorite Scion is capable of surviving the onslaught of titanspawn and changing the World. Investing time and training in Scion after Scion, the whole pantheon places tremendous trust in its heroes, although it acknowledges that many have fallen only into ruin and darkness. The next Scion, of course, will prove a worthy vessel for the Gods' trust and favor…

AESIR.NAME: AESIR
AESIR.DESCRIPTION:
Born in the wilds and ruins of Northern Europe, among Germanic warriors and Norse pirates, the Aesir make up the fourth oldest of the divine families. Their pantheon is the product of a forced union about 1,000 years ago, when the Aesir and the Vanir (an earlier pantheon) were both devastated by the Titans during a war in the North.
Relying on safety in numbers, the Aesir absorbed their rivals into their ranks and thus preserved themselves in difficult times. The Aesir represent a third option, distinct from those championed by the Dodekatheon and the Pesedjet. Aesir Scions promote community stability as a shield against the harshness of modern life. However, they also emphasize personal rights and individual honor. Therefore, while family and nation are important, injustice against a single person is grounds for action and even revenge.
Of all the divine tribes, the Aesir are most directly affected by Fate. Almost every Norse God and Goddess is destined to meet a tragic end at Ragnarök, the prophesied end of the nine worlds. Both individually and as a group, the Aesir motivate their Scions to find ways around this terrible fate. They challenge both specific persons and entire communities, fighting for greater justice and firmer commitments to order.
On the other hand, their entanglements with Fate cause many complications for the Aesir and their Scions. The Aesir's great weaknesses are a preponderance of enemies, an obsession with Fate, and a predilection for aggressive solutions (which is how they acquired so many enemies in the first place). Titanspawn must be killed first; questions can be asked later using magic, if necessary. At the same time, the bonds of Fate instigate these Gods to ask for prophecies from almost everyone, as they seek to avoid their ruin at Ragnarök. Invariably, their enemies grant them foreknowledge of their doom, with oracles that further restrict their possible courses of action.

ATZLANTI.NAME: ATZLÁNTI
ATZLANTI.DESCRIPTION:
Emerging sometime between 3,000 and 4,000 years ago, the Aztec Gods have no name for their pantheon. Other divine tribes usually call them Atzlánti. Capricious and cruel in a way that other pantheons are not, the Aztec Gods are bloodthirsty, aggressive, and violent. They sire Scions most often with mortals descended from Nahuatl-speaking tribes, wherever such native peoples exist.
For the Atzlánti, continuity is more important than community or individuality. A specific human is unimportant. Likewise, a specific village, family, clan, or nation is equally unimportant. The most important issue for this tribe is that the sun continues on its daily course, that the moon follows the sun on its appointed rounds, and that the stars continue to shine on their proper schedule.
However, normality and astronomical regularity demand bloody sacrifice, and even if other Gods deplore the Aztec Gods' methods, they cannot deny that, at least, the calendar proceeds in its usual and expected manner. Of all the divine tribes, the Atzlánti are the least concerned with the dictates of Fate or the potential ruin of the Gods. They are the most mutable in form, the most mutable in apparent purpose, and the least suspicious of their Scions' ambitions.
Of course, part of the reason for their carefree attitude toward their children is their attitude toward pain and death. What better blood to spill to ensure the continuation of the sun's course than the blood of a glorious child of the Gods? The Atzlánti have weaknesses, naturally, and their greatest obstacle is their desperate need for blood.
Blood fuels and facilitates all Aztec magic and divine powers, and while Quetzalcoátl might need only a drop for most of his works, Huitzilopochtli seems to need bucketfuls. Other Gods wonder how much of this type of sacrifice is personal preference and how much is genuine necessity. Nevertheless, the Atzlánti need blood, recently spilled animal or human blood, to play their part in preserving reality. Their Scions are similarly affected.

AMATSUKAMI.NAME: AMATSUKAMI
AMATSUKAMI.DESCRIPTION:
The Amatsukami are the celestial deities of ancient Japan. When asked how long they have existed, they will certainly answer “forever”. Other tribes usually estimate their age somewhere between that of the Dodekatheon and the Aesir, although it is possible the Amatsukami aren't lying about their age.
Regardless, the Amatsukami certainly have a different way of working in the World. The Atzlánti work to ensure the continuity of the Overworld in sync with the World. The Dodekatheon, the Aesir, and the Pesedjet work to ensure the continuity of human communities. The Amatsukami, however, emphasize the continuity of Nature — the reality of the World and all its natural wonders, the interactions between the living and the non-living to create beauty, and the changing beauty formed by states of permanent change. For the Amatsukami, to light a candle is to cast a shadow, and to kill a butterfly is to cause a drought. No action is truly separate from any other; all choices occur within a continuous framework of the Now.
Therefore, this pantheon works for the right and proper balance of all being: human individuality in cooperation with the community, in cooperation with nature, in cooperation with divinity. Their Scions work to establish “ecological” solutions to complex problems, believing that only multi-layered and beautiful answers will keep the Titans at bay. The downside of such elegant and serene natural resolutions is that they take time to implement, and there is a certain amount of hesitation about what exactly to do. The Amatsukami tend not to take the most direct route to whatever their solution is, in order to buy more time to perfect that effort. In situations where time is of the essence, the Scions of the Japanese Gods often run out of it.

LOA.NAME: LOA
LOA.DESCRIPTION:
The Loa are deities from ancient West Africa, transplanted through slavery to the Caribbean and North and South America. They make up the most mixed of the pantheons in terms of age. Gods only a few hundred years old dwell alongside Gods who walked the earth millennia ago.
Other Gods might mock the Loa as mere spirits raised above their station and rank, but their actual power and authority certainly match those of their detractors. Much of the mockery against them, therefore, is social rather than metaphysical. Of all the pantheons, the Loa remember their origins as Scions. They tend to treat their progeny with respect and honor.
In fact, the Voodoo deities seem to believe that their pantheon has not finished growing yet, and every God has a range of spirits, lesser deities, and borrowed Catholic saints to summon as messengers, allies, and companions for their Scions.
The Loa form an interesting complement to the Amatsukami. Where the Japanese pantheon works for the benefit of the totality of nature in all its diversity, the Loa focus their energy on retaining the energy and sanctity of local places.
The whole of nature is nowhere near as important as the integrity of the here-and-now for the Loa. Voodoo deities are ardent believers in the idea that small is beautiful. A house where the inhabitants live in peace, prosperity, and happiness is a good and beautiful goal for the Loa. A prosperous village or city counts as a greater achievement than saving an island or even the World. In this attention to detail, the Loa mock larger pantheons. Why bother saving the World if people die and their cities lie in ruins? What is the point if your temples are aesthetically pleasing but spiritually dead? Because the pantheon is still growing, the Gods depend on an active community of worshippers who fill them with spiritual energy. As a result, Voodoo deities suffer from a certain degree of myopia. In the pursuit of unity, prosperity, and peace at the local level, they sometimes lose sight of larger issues, such as defeating the Titans.

CRUSHING_GRIP.NAME: Crushing Grip
CRUSHING_GRIP.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is a fearsome wrestler and grappler, not to be trifled with. When he is locked in a clinch and has assumed control of it, the character may not only inflict the normal amount of damage (see p. 202), but this damage is now lethal as well. A character can still choose to hold an opponent without inflicting damage, or he may choose to break the hold. He can even soften his touch and inflict bashing damage. The damage the character can inflict when his temper flares, however, is tremendous and often quite bloody.

HOLY_BOUND.NAME: Holy Bound
HOLY_BOUND.DESCRIPTION: Only characters whose Boons include the Sky Purview have more freedom to defy the laws of physics. Simply having Epic Strength allows a Scion to perform prodigious leaps that leave mortals slack-jawed. For instance, if a Scion has Strength 5, Athletics 3, and Epic Strength 3, he can jump 12 yards (approx. 11m) straight up or 24 yards (approx. 22m) forward. (See “Movement” on p. 180.) This Knack, however, doubles a Scion's vertical and horizontal jump distances. With it, the aforementioned character could jump an incredible 24 yards straight up (from the ground to a seventh-story balcony, for example) or 48 yards forward in a single leap.

HOLY_RAMPAGE.NAME: Holy Rampage
HOLY_RAMPAGE.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is especially good at breaking inanimate objects. When he spends a point of Legend and applies all his strength to break something — whether punching, kicking, or throwing his shoulder against it — the Hardness of the item is halved against the attack. This bonus applies only when the character attempts to break an inanimate object that is loose or under his control. If someone else has control of the object in question, the Scion must take it from them first.

HURL_TO_THE_HORIZON.NAME: Hurl to the Horizon
HURL_TO_THE_HORIZON.DESCRIPTION: Baseballs, manhole covers, beer kegs, and other thrown objects become tiny dots in the distance when the Scion throws them. Having this Knack doubles the distance he can throw something as a feat of strength. It also doubles the Range of a normal thrown item after calculating the standard increase in Range granted by having Epic Strength. This Knack does not make the character more capable of seeing or hitting a target, however. Nor does it confer extra damage to an attack made with a thrown weapon.

UPLIFTING_MIGHT.NAME: Uplifting Might
UPLIFTING_MIGHT.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can lift and hold tremendous loads that would make even other Scions with Epic Strength stagger. After checking the character's lifting capacity on the “Feats of Strength” table and adjusting that capacity based on the character's Epic Strength, this Knack (and the expenditure of a point of Legend) doubles that lifting capacity. This Knack does not affect a character's ability to break or throw an object.

CATS_GRACE.NAME: Cat’s Grace
CATS_GRACE.DESCRIPTION: This Knack imbues a Scion with the uncanny ability to remain upright despite treacherous terrain or an enemy's best attempts to knock him down. For example, a character with this Knack never suffers knockdown (see p. 198) from an attack. The player doesn't even need to roll. The character still takes the damage, but remains on his feet. Additionally, a character with this Knack ignores all difficulty penalties based on unstable footing and treacherous terrain. He still suffers speed penalties for moving through ankle-to-knee-deep water or mud, but his dice pools for actions taken in such terrain suffer no penalties.

LIGHTNING_SPRINTER.NAME: Lightning Sprinter
LIGHTNING_SPRINTER.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is lightning on two legs, whizzing past as a blur, leaving behind leaves, sand, or loose ground debris he has already covered. This Knack doubles the amount of distance he can cover in a Dash action, after calculating the new Dash distance based on his Epic Dexterity. Furthermore, it negates the movement penalties a character would accumulate for dashing through water or mud that is between ankle and shoulder height, provided that: A) the character started his Dash action on terrain without such penalty, and B) the character continues to perform consecutive Dash actions. As long as he keeps running, his feet skim across the surface of the water or mud like a skipping stone. If he slows down or stops, however, he sinks into the sucking terrain to suffer normal penalties. Activating this Knack costs one Legend point.

MONKEY_CLIMBER.NAME: Monkey Climber
MONKEY_CLIMBER.DESCRIPTION: Provided he has sufficient hand and footholds, the Scion climbs vertical surfaces with cavalier ease. Where a normal climber might cover only half the distance they would cover in a normal Move action on a successful climb check (see p. 180), a Scion with this Knack suffers no such restriction. Furthermore, provided the Scion has at least one hand (or both feet) on the surface he is climbing, he can perform a second action at the same time (per multiple action rules on p. 179) while still moving along the climbing surface. The Scion cannot “Dash” while climbing, but the bonus to his movement granted by his Epic Dexterity still applies.

TRICK_SHOOTER.NAME: Trick Shooter
TRICK_SHOOTER.DESCRIPTION: Not only do the Scion's Epic Dexterity bonus successes add to (Dexterity + Marksmanship) dice rolls, he now doubles the bonus he receives when performing an Aim action (see p. 190). Additionally, the player ignores the difficulty penalty for the character to disarm an opponent with a special ranged attack or to mark his opponent without dealing damage. (See “Special Attacks” on p. 199.) A character must perform an Aim action to be able to ignore such penalties, however. If a character fires from the hip or fires wildly in a gunfight filled with the smell of cordite and a shower of casings, only the regular bonus successes from his Epic Dexterity apply.

UNTUCHABLE_OPPONENT.NAME: Untouchable Opponent
UNTUCHABLE_OPPONENT.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion might as well be a ghost for the difficulty his enemies have in laying a hand or weapon on him. The Scion doubles the benefit his Epic Dexterity points add to his Dodge DV. He also ignores a number of DV penalties due to unstable terrain equal to his Epic Dexterity points. Only the normal Epic Dexterity bonus applies to the character's Parry DV, however, and this Knack's bonus to Dodge DV does not apply if the character is merely hiding behind cover. Only if the character is physically dodging the attacks coming his way does this Knack help him.
Activating this Knack costs one Legend point. Its effects last for one scene.

DAMAGE_CONVERSION.NAME: Damage Conversion
DAMAGE_CONVERSION.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can spend a single Legend point to convert all lethal damage from a single attack into bashing damage, though an overload of bashing damage will still wrap existing bashing damage into lethal (see p. 197). This Knack cannot convert aggravated damage into anything less severe. The character cannot convert old lethal damage into bashing damage. The Knack works only on damage received from a single attack.

HOLY_FORTITUDE.NAME: Holy Fortitude
HOLY_FORTITUDE.DESCRIPTION: The character is the epitome of the sacred ascetic. The periods for which he is able to go without food, water, and sleep double. The amount of time he is able to work at a strenuous task without stopping also doubles.

INNER_FURNACE.NAME: Inner Furnace
INNER_FURNACE.DESCRIPTION:
The character rarely lacks sustenance. Provided he can find some kind of organic substance (from rotten quail eggs to a piece of notebook paper where someone blew their nose), the Scion can eat and survive. And provided he finds a water source (no matter how stagnant or polluted it might be), he can drink and survive. Any pestilence or poison hidden in what he consumes burns up in the fires of his superior constitution, without even requiring a Fortitude check. The same goes for drugs or poisons he ingests on purpose, or for any "roofie" a malefactor might try to slip him. He is still just as susceptible to airborne toxins and any drug injected into his bloodstream, but any drug that has to pass through the stomach first stops there.
This Knack does nothing to suppress the gag reflex or make an unappetizing meal taste any better.

SELF_HEALING.NAME: Self–Healing
SELF_HEALING.DESCRIPTION: The Scion's player spends a Legend point to repair a single level of damage. This damage can be bashing or lethal, and the healing occurs in an instant without leaving a scar. (Aggravated damage is beyond the power of this Knack to heal.) Scions interested in building their reputation and spreading their legends quickly discover that this Knack is one of the most effective tools for doing so, as bruises, lacerations, and bullet holes disappear before the eyes of astonished onlookers.

SOLIPSISTIC_WELL_BEING.NAME: Solipsistic Well–Being
SOLIPSISTIC_WELL_BEING.DESCRIPTION:
The philosophy of solipsism holds that only the self exists. Consequently, if a solipsist is not aware of something, that something does not exist. With this Knack, a Scion applies this strange philosophy to damage that surprises him. For a single attack that the Scion does not see, hear, or otherwise perceive coming, the Scion can spend a Legend point and a Willpower point to ignore it completely as if it never happened (thus suffering no damage from it). Of course, the attack actually happens — any ammo used is spent, bystanders might be covered in the Scion's blood, the would-be assassin might be standing there holding a dripping knife — but such concerns are immaterial to the Scion victim.
The Scion can use this Knack only once per scene.

BENEFIT_OF_THE_DOUBT.NAME: Benefit of the Doubt
BENEFIT_OF_THE_DOUBT.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes, for a Scion to help people — or convince them to stay out of danger — those people have to accept ideas that would seem patently ridiculous if they weren't true. A Scion's player with this Knack spends a Legend point, and something in the Scion's posture or expression convinces a single listener not to dismiss what he is saying. Maybe it's the fact that the Scion is taking his words so seriously, or maybe he just has an honest face. Maybe he came highly recommended by a respected colleague. Whatever the reason, the listener gives the Scion the benefit of the doubt regarding what the Scion attempts to explain next, despite what he might be inclined to believe.

BLESSING_OF_IMPORTANCE.NAME: Blessing of Importance
BLESSING_OF_IMPORTANCE.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is especially good at winning people over by making them feel special and wanted. By spending a Legend point and championing a person, calling them out in a crowd, or just giving them a secret smile, the Scion recharges that person's spent Willpower points for the scene. The Scion doesn't necessarily have to believe the person is important or special. This Knack works great on mortals but is less effective on Scions, who are usually aware of their charismatic peers' methods. For Scion recipients, the Knack recharges only one Willpower point per dot of Epic Charisma the Scion with this Knack possesses. A character can receive this Willpower boost only once per scene from the same Scion.

CHARMER.NAME: Charmer
CHARMER.DESCRIPTION: With the sheer raw charm this Knack represents, the Scion can smother an outbreak of panic, suspicion, or outright hatred directed at him for one scene. The player need only spend a Legend point. A scene is usually long enough to convince a person that it would be in their best interest to help the character, but it falls to the Scion (and the player's roleplaying) to actually say the right words. During the scene in which this Knack is in effect, the suppressed emotion does not disappear. It just lingers beneath the surface. If the Scion fails to soothe the person's mind by the end of the scene, the suppressed emotion returns with full force the next time the Scion leaves the affected person's presence.

INSPIRATIONAL_FIGURE.NAME: Inspirational Figure
INSPIRATIONAL_FIGURE.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion's well-chosen words can tap into humanity's social mindset, giving hope and courage not just to one listener, but to a group. The Scion makes a speech to the assembled listeners — whether asking for help, lifting spirits after a local disaster, or strengthening community bonds among them — and spends a single Legend point. As long as his words are intended to inspire them in some way, every person who can hear him listens spellbound and receives a Willpower point at the end of the speech. The only limit is that the listeners must be able to hear him clearly without the aid of any amplification or broadcasting equipment.
This Knack inspires other Scions as easily as mortals, but does not inspire titanspawn. However, titanspawn are compelled to at least let him finish his speech before carrying out whatever they are plotting.

NEVER_SAY_DIE.NAME: Never Say Die
NEVER_SAY_DIE.DESCRIPTION: Not every Scion manages to knock down enemies like bowling pins and scatter titanspawn body parts in his wake. Yet, some are so full of optimism and joie de vivre, even when getting beaten due to some spectacular failure, that you just can't help but love them. A Scion might be accident-prone or have an annoying knack for picking fights with titanspawn out of his league, but he takes his lumps with a grin and inspires his companions with his positive attitude. All he has to do is give a thumbs-up, shout an “I'm okay!” or flash a smile full of dangling teeth. When he does this, all Scions in his Band who can see him gain one Willpower point per health level the character has suffered (that is, however many are marked on his character sheet at that moment). The character can inspire his companions this way only once per scene, but he can do so even if knocked down to Incapacitated or killed — after which, he collapses.

BLURT_IT_OUT.NAME: Blurt It Out
BLURT_IT_OUT.DESCRIPTION:
This Knack represents a gift for making people speak their minds. Scions who possess it typically corner a person who has information they want, start a conversation, steer that conversation toward the information in question, and then pull it out when it's on the tip of the tongue. Others confront victims surrounded by family, friends, or coworkers, in order to make those victims admit damning information when it will cause the most damage. The Scion's player must spend a Legend point to activate the Knack, and the information must have legitimately come up in the conversation. The Scion cannot simply shout “J’accuse!” and use Blurt It Out to force a random confession from a guilty person. (The declamatory French comes only after the Scion uses Blurt It Out effectively.)
Regardless, a victim still has a small chance to catch themselves before bringing about disaster. The victim's player rolls (Willpower + Integrity + Legend) against a difficulty equal to (Scion's Epic Manipulation + 1). If this roll is successful, the player can then spend a Willpower point to avoid the slip.

GODS_HONEST.NAME: Gods’ Honest
GODS_HONEST.DESCRIPTION:
When trying to convince someone of something, the Scion places his hand on his heart, places his hand on a stack of Bibles, raises his right hand with pinky and thumb crossed in the palm, or performs some other gesture of sincerity. (His player also spends a Legend point.) When he does this, his target accepts that the Scion is telling the truth about the matter at hand, no questions asked, for the rest of the story. Only solid, incontrovertible proof showing that what the Scion said was undeniably false will convince the target that he was deceived. Even then, whoever is showing him the proof will have to convince him that the proof is genuine and not some clever forgery.
A Scion with this Knack need not lie when using it. He can also use it to convince a recalcitrant skeptic of the actual truth. If the Scion does so, no mortal force can convince that person that the Scion was lying (not even professionally forged "proof" to the contrary).

OVERT_ORDER.NAME: Overt Order
OVERT_ORDER.DESCRIPTION:
Sometimes, the direct method is more effective than the cleverest of intricate schemes. With this Knack, a Scion barks a command that the target must obey. Doing so costs one Willpower point, and the command must be one that the Scion can give and the victim can perform in a single action. “Freeze!” is acceptable, as is “Don't shoot!” or “Shoot him!”. Ordering someone to go home and shoot his wife won't work because doing so would take longer than a single action.
A victim of this Knack can interpret the command freely to make it not directly suicidal, but not if all they are trying to do is avoid trouble. For instance, if a victim draws a gun and the Scion commands them to shoot themselves, the victim might shoot themselves in the hand or foot instead of blowing their own brains out. The same goes if a Scion uses this Knack in a seedy pool hall to command a drug dealer to pick a fight with a burly ex-con at the next table. The dealer might reasonably believe the ex-con could kill him, but he still cannot shirk the command. He doesn't have to walk over there and punch the guy, but he still has to do something, like shout a racial slur or throw a beer bottle at the guy's girlfriend. The dealer might flee immediately, but he still has to pick the fight first.

STENCH_OF_GUILT.NAME: Stench of Guilt
STENCH_OF_GUILT.DESCRIPTION: This Knack gives a Scion insight into the workings of a victim's mind. If the Scion hears a topic come up while the victim is speaking that reminds the victim of a misdeed they are keeping secret, the Scion senses the presence of that secret. The victim need not feel guilty about the wrongs they have committed, but provided they have striven, or are striving, to hide them, the Scion notices. This Knack cannot reveal what secret the victim is hiding, nor does it specifically point out what was said in the conversation that reminded them of the transgression. The context of the conversation is usually enough for an astute Scion to figure out where to start looking, however.

TAKES_ONE_TO_KNOW_ONE.NAME: Takes One to Know One
TAKES_ONE_TO_KNOW_ONE.DESCRIPTION: Liars and cheaters recognize their own. If any con artist tries to pull a scam, Scions with this Knack know exactly what kind of person they are dealing with. Whenever the Scion hears a person knowingly tell a lie, the Scion becomes automatically aware of the deception. This Knack does not reveal what the actual truth is. Nor does it work on text written by someone who knows it is false or when someone speaks false words in a language the Scion does not understand.

CENTER_OF_ATTENTION.NAME: Center of Attention
CENTER_OF_ATTENTION.DESCRIPTION:
Whether he is Hugh Jackman on the set of The View or the Phantom of the Opera going unmasked to the masquerade ball, the Scion commands the attention of everyone in the room. This Knack is best used when making a grand entrance, but can also serve as a wonderful broad-spectrum distraction. The character enters a room, the player spends a Legend point, and every eye in the room (as well as the eyes of people watching remotely via live security camera feed) turns to the character. For each Legend point spent, the character can hold everyone's attention for a number of minutes equal to his Epic Appearance dots. Bystanders can continue with what they are doing and carry on conversations with each other, but their attention remains fixed on the Scion.
Titanspawn and Scions can resist this Knack. They can spend a Willpower point to direct their attention elsewhere. If the Scion with Epic Appearance spends another Legend point to continue the effect for subsequent sets of minutes, the resisting party must spend corresponding amounts of Willpower to avoid becoming distracted.

COME_HITHER.NAME: Come Hither
COME_HITHER.DESCRIPTION:
Some Scions are so beautiful that you can't help but be drawn to them, and a Scion with this Knack makes that attraction irresistible and inescapable. Whether waving from across a crowded room, emailing a picture of herself with an invitation, or texting a picture message from her phone with the caption “CMERE”, the object of her desire hurries to reach her. The Scion's player spends a Legend point and must single out one recipient at a time. The intended target must be able to see an image of the Scion, must understand that the message is meant for him, and must have a reasonable idea of how to find her.
Scions whose Epic Appearance represents divine ugliness cannot use this Knack. Furthermore, it does not work on beautiful Scions with more Epic Appearance dots than the one using the Knack.

DREADFUL_MIEN.NAME: Dreadful Mien
DREADFUL_MIEN.DESCRIPTION:
Some Scions are so hideous that seeing them stimulates the primitive centers of the human brain to reckless flight. Most humans manage to suppress this instinctive response and remain in the presence of such Scions, but this Knack overrides that social nicety. When the Scion's player spends a Legend point, the character directs his unholy monstrosity at a single hapless victim in his presence. Overwhelmed, the victim runs for his life and hides somewhere until the next sunrise. People affected by this Knack flee with self-preservation in mind, however, so they won't run blindly into traffic or try to swim across a shark tank to safety.
Scions whose Epic Appearance represents divine beauty cannot use this Knack. Furthermore, it does not work on hideous Scions with more Epic Appearance dots than the one using the Knack.

LASTING_IMPRESSION.NAME: Lasting Impression
LASTING_IMPRESSION.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion has an effect on a subject that lingers. Thoughts of the Scion invade the victim's mind uninvited, either to undermine their concentration or to lift their spirits. A beautiful Scion can use her Epic Appearance to make a character feel good about themselves, granting them an extra Willpower point (which can exceed the character's maximum) and an extra die on any Art, Athletics, Command, Craft, or Integrity dice pools. A hideous Scion inflicts exactly the opposite effect. The fear she instills robs her victim of a Willpower point that they cannot recover until the effect passes. The Scion also disturbs them so deeply that they lose a die from all Academics, Awareness, Control, Politics, or Presence dice pools.
Using this Knack costs the Scion a single Legend point, and its effects last for 24 hours. The Scion can use the Knack on only one person at a time, and the target must be able to see her in person.

SERPENT_GAZE.NAME: Serpent’s Gaze
SERPENT_GAZE.DESCRIPTION:
When the Scion spends a Legend point, the person he is trying to affect locks gazes with him and is unable to look away. For combat purposes, the victim becomes Inactive until the Scion breaks eye contact. The Scion can still act, but must perform a second action to do so, maintaining eye contact as a non-rolled action. (As a result, he suffers a -2 penalty to any other action he performs.) This Knack works equally well whether the Scion's Epic Appearance involves beauty or its opposite.
Characters of lower Legend are unable to break the Scion's gaze on their own, but those with equal or higher Legend are not so vulnerable. After the Scion using the Knack performs a full action, the victim of equal or higher Legend can spend a Willpower point to negate the effect. Upon doing so, he remains immune to the effect from the same Scion for the rest of the scene.

PERFECT_PITCH.NAME: Perfect Pitch
PERFECT_PITCH.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can be a musician's best friend or worst nightmare, as she has the innate ability to detect even the subtlest variation in musical pitch. Her sense is so refined that she could pick out a single stray note in an otherwise flawless performance of a Rachmaninoff concert. The one mistake in the middle of the performance rings as clearly in her ears as if someone's cell phone had gone off during the performance playing the SpongeBob theme song. The Scion's sense of hearing is also refined enough to be able to identify with absolute certainty a phone number or security code just by listening to the distinctive key tones.

PREDATORY_FOCUS.NAME: Predatory Focus
PREDATORY_FOCUS.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is a hunter par excellence. With a successful (Perception + Survival) roll, he can track his prey by scent alone or by nearly invisible physical signs. With this Knack, the hunter can follow his prey across any type of terrain, provided the prey continues to flee and takes no significant steps to mask its scent or minimize the disturbance its passage causes. (The former involves extremes like swimming a mile upstream in a rushing river or taking refuge inside a working pig processing plant. The latter includes little short of levitating or flying.) Picking up a lost trail with this Knack requires a new (Perception + Survival) roll. If the prey has Epic Wits or an Arete in Stealth (see pp. 149-150), the hunter's roll is contested against the prey's (Wits + Stealth).

REFINED_PALATE.NAME: Refined Palate
REFINED_PALATE.DESCRIPTION: The Scion has exceptionally precise senses of taste and smell (since the latter enhances the former). With a faint whiff or a tentative taste, the Scion can figure out what ingredients make up a certain mixture and in what proportions. He can also sniff out drugs or poisons that have been added to what he was about to devour, as well as detect airborne toxins by the way they make the air taste. This Knack does not tell a Scion what an ingredient is if he is not already familiar with it. (He would realize that what is making his iced tea sweet is not sugar, for instance, but he wouldn't know it's artificial sweetener if he had never tasted it before.) Instead, the Knack registers each component separately and provides an indication if such components would be dangerous to consume. The Scion also remembers the taste and smell of various ingredients he tries so he can recognize and identify them if exposed to them again.

SUBLIMINAL_WARNING.NAME: Subliminal Warning
SUBLIMINAL_WARNING.DESCRIPTION: Whenever the Scion enters an area where an ambush is waiting, even if he has no reason to suspect he is in danger, certain small clues put his subconscious on alert, preparing him for an attack. When the attacker finally launches the surprise attack, the Scion hears the slightest rustle of fabric, sees the slightest twitch in his peripheral vision, or feels the softest movement of displaced air, and the clues he has already noticed add up. As a result, the Scion gains an extra number of dice equal to his Epic Perception on the standard (Wits + Awareness) roll to detect the ambush.

UNFAILING_RECOGNITION.NAME: Unfailing Recognition
UNFAILING_RECOGNITION.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can automatically recognize any people to whom she is Fatebound. She can pick out their faces in a crowd with just a glance. She can recognize their voices despite electronic distortion or overwhelming background noise. She knows their scents and their body language and even the exact feel of the way they shake hands. She can also recognize an impostor when someone tries to imitate the voice or appearance of someone she is Fatebound to.
Recognizing others isn't as easy. If, when a Scion meets a character she is not Fatebound to, she makes a concerted effort to try to remember that character's appearance and mannerisms, the player can spend a Willpower point to lock that image in the Scion's mind. Thereafter, she retains the ability to recognize him despite all obfuscation for the rest of the story, as if the two were Fatebound. Afterward, the Scion loses any supernatural ability she had to recognize that character. (She doesn't forget the character's appearance, mind you. It's just that the Knack no longer applies to that person.)
The moment the Scion recognizes a person depends entirely on the Storyteller, as dictated by the needs of the story. If the private investigator stalking the Scion tries to approach the character in disguise at a crowded charity event, the Scion might spot the detective coming from a mile away (even despite the fake beard, padding, spray tan, and sex change). If a Scion of Loki who is a rival to a player's Scion of Anubis arrives in disguise to deliver a cryptic warning, the Scion of Anubis might not recognize her old enemy until the trickster disappears with a wink behind the closing elevator doors.
Finally, as a side effect of this Knack, a Scion can always recognize when someone who isn't disguised is biologically related to a person she knows well (regardless of whether that person is Fatebound to her). She cannot intuitively grasp what that relationship is, but she knows it exists — even if the person in question does not.

FAST_LEARNER.NAME: Fast Learner
FAST_LEARNER.DESCRIPTION: By applying himself and studying certain subjects intensely, the Scion internalizes them in a fraction of the time it would take a lesser intellect. When doing so, he halves the experience point cost to buy dots in Academics, Medicine, Occult, Politics, or Science, rounding down.

KNOW_IT_ALL.NAME: Know–It–All
KNOW_IT_ALL.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is widely read and has a ridiculously thorough education. She may not be a master of any single subject, but she knows a little bit about a wide range of disparate and esoteric subjects. (She could explain the intricacies of the Teapot Dome Scandal in terms of the interpersonal dynamics of the Justice League, then explain why typing certain commands into a UNIX system is a bad idea, before finishing with an explanation of how a Venus flytrap works.) Usually, the burden of roleplaying this Knack falls on the player, so it behooves him to keep an eye out for obscure trivia he can insert into his character's dialogue during play. The Storyteller shares some of this burden as well. During a scene where the characters seem to be stumped or out of options, the Storyteller should “remind” the player of some pertinent piece of obscure trivia his character knows that has direct and helpful relevance to the problem at hand. It behooves the Storyteller, then, to make a list of some of these helpful hints when designing his story. Just in case.

MATH_GENIUS.NAME: Math Genius
MATH_GENIUS.DESCRIPTION: The Scion is a walking, talking calculator. She can split a restaurant bill for 10 people so everyone pays only what they owe or calculate the standard deviation of oil prices over the last 15 years, all while carrying on an intense conversation about whether Republicans or Democrats tip worse. Provided she knows all the numbers involved, she can crunch the numbers in her head with only a moment's pause. She can also use mathematical shorthand and quick calculus to estimate things like how many jellybeans are in a glass jar at the State Fair or how many Civil War reenactors possessed by titanspawn are charging toward her across the picnic grounds.

PERFECT_MEMORY.NAME: Perfect Memory
PERFECT_MEMORY.DESCRIPTION: The character remembers everything about his past, from before the game started to the current moment in the story. If the player forgets an important point or key piece of information from previous sessions, he need only ask the Storyteller and the Storyteller will remind him. It's a good idea for the character's player to take copious notes on the events of each session and verify them with the Storyteller, if only to relieve some of the stress on the Storyteller.

TEACHING_PRODIGY.NAME: Teaching Prodigy
TEACHING_PRODIGY.DESCRIPTION:
With this Knack, a Scion can help another person become a fast learner (per the eponymous Knack). When she makes significant efforts to teach a student in a subject — a distinction better left to the Storyteller — the experience point cost to buy dots in the Ability the teacher teaches is cut in half, rounded down.
The catch built into this Knack is that a Scion cannot teach a student an Ability that she (the teacher) does not possess. Nor can the teacher help a student surpass her in mastery of a subject — which is to say that the Scion cannot teach her student more dots in an Ability than she (the teacher) possesses.

INSTANT_INVESTIGATOR.NAME: Instant Investigator
INSTANT_INVESTIGATOR.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can take an intuitive “read” of a crime scene and make a reasonably accurate assessment of what happened there. Spending a Legend point and taking a single general look at a crime scene, the Scion entitles his player to a reflexive (Wits + Investigation) roll. If the roll succeeds, the Scion can tell what crimes were committed at that scene (if more than one), how many perpetrators were involved, how long ago it happened, roughly the sequence of events that occurred, and what means the perpetrators employed to cover up evidence. The difficulty of the roll should reflect how long ago the crime occurred, how contaminated the crime scene has been since then, and how thorough the criminals were in covering their tracks.
This Knack does not reveal specific, plot-sensitive information that isn't readily apparent (like who the perpetrators actually are), but it should provide enough clues in a single glance for the character to develop solid leads that advance the story.

MEDITATIVE_FOCUS.NAME: Meditative Focus
MEDITATIVE_FOCUS.DESCRIPTION: Whether she is crouching behind a burning car in a war zone, trapped in the yard during a prison riot, stranded on the crowded deck of a storm-lashed ship, or just walking in the mall during the Christmas shopping frenzy, the character never loses her cool. No matter what is happening, she keeps her mind on what she is doing while maintaining enough vigilance to avoid getting caught up in the tumult around her. As such, the character is able to eliminate one point of environmental distraction penalty per dot she has of Epic Wits.

OPENING_GAMBIT.NAME: Opening Gambit
OPENING_GAMBIT.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes, victory in conflict is all about being the guy who makes the first move, and the Scion is usually that guy. When he joins battle, his player can make a Join Battle roll like everyone else, or he can simply spend a Legend point for his character to automatically go first in the reaction count. This Knack cannot automatically preempt an otherwise unexpected attack, however, as the character must actually be able to join battle for this Knack to work. If more than one character involved in a combat scene has this Knack, the character with the highest (Wits + Epic Wits) total goes first. If characters with this Knack have equal totals, the default is a separate Join Battle roll to see which of them acts first.

RABBIT_REFLEXES.NAME: Rabbit Reflexes
RABBIT_REFLEXES.DESCRIPTION: When an unexpected attack targets the character with this Knack, but the character's player fails to get enough successes on the (Wits + Awareness) roll to notice the incoming attack, the Scion instinctively defends herself with double her highest applicable DV. The character cannot preemptively attack her attacker or even shout a warning to her comrades, as she is reacting to an attack that is already occurring, but she is much more likely to dodge or parry that attack. However, the character cannot actually join battle until everyone else does after the unexpected attack is resolved.

SOCIAL_CHAMELEON.NAME: Social Chameleon
SOCIAL_CHAMELEON.DESCRIPTION: Being thrown into a situation full of strangers who have bizarre customs and strange manners (like a fraternity house at the height of hazing) can be disorienting, but the character with this Knack carries herself with remarkable aplomb. Observing the behavior of people around her and reacting supernaturally fast to their reactions to her behavior, she can fake fitting in just about anywhere, with any class of people. She still has to dress appropriately, and the language barrier might present its own problems, but she won't embarrass or draw attention to herself unless she goes out of her way to do so on purpose.

PURVIEWS.DESCRIPTION: These Purviews are the most common. Although associated with specific Gods, they are available to Scions of any heritage. Each Boon can be purchased separately and out of sequence. Using general-purpose Boons requires a Birthright.

ANIMAL.NAME: ANIMAL
ANIMAL.DESCRIPTION:
This Purview expresses the totemic power to which a Scion's ichor grants him access. Its Boons work only on one type of animal, chosen by the player when he purchases the character's first Boon. This animal need not be the same one associated with his divine parent.
Associated With: Anubis (Jackal), Athena (Owl), Atum-Re (Falcon), Bastet (Cat), Damballa (Snake), Geb (Goose), Hachiman (Dove), Hera (Peacock), Horus (Falcon), Huitzilopochtli (Hummingbird, Eagle), Miclántecuhtli (Dog), Osiris (Centipede, Ram), Poseidon (Horse), Quetzalcoátl (Resplendent Quetzal), Set (Salawa), Sobek (Crocodile), Tezcatlipoca (Jaguar), Thoth (Baboon, Ibis)

ANIMAL_COMMUNICATION.NAME: ANIMAL COMMUNICATION
ANIMAL_COMMUNICATION.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can understand and make himself understood by an animal while speaking his native language, and the animal responds with its own postures, scents, and/or vocalizations. This Boon does not make animals intelligent, calm, or loyal, but most are curious enough upon having a person address them to listen to the Scion before resorting to aggression, panic, or indifference.

ANIMAL_COMMAND.NAME: ANIMAL COMMAND
ANIMAL_COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: The Scion spends a Willpower point and names a task the animal must perform. The task cannot seem suicidal or impossible to the animal, but the animal cannot refuse an order that doesn't immediately appear so. “Hey rabbit, go tear out that lion's throat,” would seem impossible to the rabbit so commanded. “Run to that grass across the street,” would be a fine order for the same rabbit, even if cars were driving by. The order can describe a single immediate action (“Bite that guy!”) or one with a single condition (“Come find me when a blue car pulls up here.”). If he lacks the previous Boon, the Scion can deliver his command only through simplistic non-verbal signs.

ANIMAL_ASPECT.NAME: ANIMAL ASPECT
ANIMAL_ASPECT.DESCRIPTION: Meditating for an action (Speed 3) on a symbol representing his animal, the Scion assumes a metaphorical trait associated with it, creating a dice bonus for rolls involving the Attribute most closely associated with that trait. A Scion might assume the sinuous grace of a snake (Dexterity), the beauty of a peacock (Appearance), the proverbial memory of an elephant (via Intelligence), or any other justifiable trait. The bonus dice equal the number of successes on the activation roll, and the benefit lasts one action per Legend point spent upfront to fuel the Boon.

CHAOS.NAME: CHAOS
CHAOS.DESCRIPTION:
Chaos is the Purview of confusion, anarchy, and formlessness.
Associated With: Dionysus, Kalfu, Loki, Set, Susano-o

EYE_OF_THE_STORM.NAME: EYE OF THE STORM
EYE_OF_THE_STORM.DESCRIPTION: When the Scion finds herself caught in a chaotic situation unrelated to her — whether dodging debris from a tornado or stepping out of a bar to find an angry mob rushing toward her to clash with a line of riot police down the street — she can activate this Boon and become an island of calm in the turmoil. She is miraculously untouched in the confusion and remains so as long as she does not actively involve herself. She still suffers normal environmental movement penalties, but environmental hazards like falling rocks, stampeding beasts, or thrashing protesters do not touch her.

HORNETS_NEST.NAME: HORNET’S NEST
HORNETS_NEST.DESCRIPTION: If the activation roll for the Boon is successful, the Storyteller must determine and reveal in general terms what action the Scion can take to cause the most chaos in the scene or neutralize the potential chaos inherent in the situation. The revelation should be something simple like “open the parrot cage,” “stand in the hallway,” “wink at Sif's Scion,” or “call Ptah's Scion's cell phone.” The Storyteller should explain only which action will lead to which result, not how.

PARALYZING_CONFUSION.NAME: PARALYZING CONFUSION
PARALYZING_CONFUSION.DESCRIPTION:
This Boon turns a person's rational thoughts into seething, chaotic noise. On a successful activation roll, the victim freezes in place, suddenly unable to think, speak, or act. He is unaware of what happens around him and has no memory of the moments before or after the use of this Boon.
The effect lasts a number of actions equal to the successes on the activation roll, and erases the victim's memory for an equal period prior to the roll. If the victim has more Legend points than the user, the power does not work. If the victim has an equal Legend rating, the activation roll is contested against the victim's (Willpower + Integrity + Legend).

DARKNESS.NAME: DARKNESS
DARKNESS.DESCRIPTION:
Characters who inherit this Purview are as at home in the dark as in the light (if not more so), protecting humanity from unseen terrors or tormenting hapless mortals from the shadows.
Associated With: Baron Samedi, Hades, Izanami, Kalfu, Tezcatlipoca, Tsuki-yomi

NIGHT_EYES.NAME: NIGHT EYES
NIGHT_EYES.DESCRIPTION: Darkness no longer imposes visibility penalties on the character. He can see in total darkness almost as well as he can see in bright sunlight, losing only the ability to perceive color. (Objects he sees in darkness are black-on-black, but perfectly distinguishable in a way that is conveniently impossible to describe to someone who lacks this Boon.) The Scion cannot see through physical impediments, however.

SHADOW_MASK.NAME: SHADOW MASK
SHADOW_MASK.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion pulls a shadow from the brim of his hat or from under his collar and wraps it around his head, becoming completely unrecognizable to human eyes or electronic surveillance equipment (even equipment specifically designed to see in the dark). His voice becomes an unidentifiable whisper. The Scion can see through this mask, and other Scions using Night Eyes can recognize him through it.
The shadow mask lasts for a maximum of 24 hours. The Scion can will it to disperse before that period ends, but otherwise, it stays in place the whole time, even if the Scion is unconscious. It does not disperse even if someone shines a bright light in the Scion's face.

SHADOW_REFUGE.NAME: SHADOW REFUGE
SHADOW_REFUGE.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can hide inside any shadow his body fits into. He need only position himself within the three-dimensional area of the shadow while his player succeeds on the activation roll and spends the Legend point. If he does so, mundane attempts to find him — even those aided by electronic equipment — automatically fail. Supernatural attempts aided by Epic Perception or an Arete in Awareness (or both) proceed normally, contesting the seeker's (Perception + Awareness) against the Scion's activation roll.
The Scion can hide inside the shadow as long as it remains large enough. He can move with it as it moves, but doing so might require a new (Dexterity + Stealth) roll depending on the circumstances.

DEATH.NAME: DEATH
DEATH.DESCRIPTION:
The Gods do not share mortals' instinctive dread of death, but they know its power well. Likewise, as a Scion's mastery of this Purview grows, his fear of death diminishes.
Associated With: Anubis, Baron Samedi, Hades, Hel, Huitzilopochtli, Izanami, Miclántecuhtli, Odin, Osiris, Xipe Totec

DEATH_SENSES.NAME: DEATH SENSES
DEATH_SENSES.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can see ghosts even when those ghosts do not choose to manifest. To her, ghosts are livid, physical presences, sensitive to touch as much as sight (as well as smell and hearing). She still cannot harm the fragile ectoplasmic shell of a ghost that has not manifested, however. The sense of touch this Boon grants is illusory. If the Scion attempts to exert enough pressure to cause damage or restrain the ghost, her hand passes through it.
The Scion can also look at a dead body and know what killed it, if that cause isn't already obvious. The answer she gets is somewhat generic (the reading would tell her a person was poisoned, for example, but not by which poison), but it is conclusive despite the presence of falsified or misleading evidence. Generic causes of death include suffocation, drowning, poison, burns, internal trauma, bleeding, starvation, thirst, exposure, disease, heart attack, and old age.

EUTHANASIA.NAME: EUTHANASIA
EUTHANASIA.DESCRIPTION: When a living being is at the Incapacitated health level with lethal or aggravated damage due to wounds or a terminal illness, the Scion can end that being's suffering. The Scion must touch the being for one action (Speed 6) and spend a Legend point. If the Scion wants to know if the victim is truly willing to die, her player can roll (Perception + Empathy) while the Scion touches the victim. Animals usually respond affirmatively and titanspawn usually do the opposite, but human beings and Scions are unpredictable. Regardless, the subject's will is ultimately immaterial, unless the subject is another Scion. The power does not work on a Scion unless that Scion is truly willing to die. (Even then, however, Fate or the Scion's divine parent might intervene to keep the Scion alive a little longer.)

UNQUIET_CORPSE.NAME: UNQUIET CORPSE
UNQUIET_CORPSE.DESCRIPTION:
By touching a corpse or its grave with her hand or her Birthright, a Scion can raise that corpse as a mindless zombie (or its appropriate pantheon equivalent) under her control. Only limbs that are present and firmly attached to the zombie's torso (even if only by leather straps and wooden staples) function when the zombie rises. The zombie remains animated until it is destroyed or the Scion who created it dies.
(Traits and rules for such undead appear on pages 293-294.)

EARTH.NAME: EARTH
EARTH.DESCRIPTION:
In most Creation legends, the Gods or their forebears shaped the World from the protomatter of the Void. In other legends, they threw down impenetrable walls, sank islands, and reshaped landmasses. This Purview is the legacy of that power.
Associated With: Baron Samedi, Geb, Hades, Hephaestus, Izanami, Osiris, Poseidon, Quetzalcoátl, Tlaloc, Tlazoltéotl

SAFELY_INTERRED.NAME: SAFELY INTERRED
SAFELY_INTERRED.DESCRIPTION: If the character is caught in a landslide, buried in a shallow roadside grave, or trapped in the rubble of a collapsing building, he need not fear the embrace of the earth, provided he has his Earth Birthright. No amount of collapsing debris can break the Scion's bones (or the Birthright itself), and he will not suffocate, no matter how much dirt piles atop him. If he lacks the strength to free himself, however, he risks dying of starvation or thirst if no one digs him out. Still, it wouldn't be the earth that killed him, but his own lack of fortitude.

ECHO_SOUNDING.NAME: ECHO SOUNDING
ECHO_SOUNDING.DESCRIPTION:
By stomping his foot or otherwise striking the earth, the Scion gets a sense of its general composition and density, as well as finding holes or caverns beneath the surface. If he is looking for something specific in the earth — like gold, oil, or a human body — this Boon reveals its distance from him and depth from the epicenter, to the detriment of other information.
The Boon works only at ground level or on the raised surface of a mountainside, but works through floors and pavement. It gives the Scion a semi-spherical reading with a radius equal to half a mile per Legend point.

SHAPING.NAME: SHAPING
SHAPING.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can sculpt stone, concrete, baked clay, or metal with his bare hands. When he spends the Legend point, the substance becomes malleable like wet clay as long as he is touching it. With a successful (Dexterity + Craft) roll by his player, the Scion can mold it into any shape his nimble fingers can produce.
The Scion can affect up to a cubic foot of material at a time. Once he breaks contact with the substance he is molding, it loses all malleability and hardens into its new shape.

FERTILITY.NAME: FERTILITY
FERTILITY.DESCRIPTION:
This Purview deals with plant life, from the smallest dandelion seed to the largest sequoia. The concept of fertility regarding animal reproduction is covered by the Health Purview.
Associated With: Amaterasu, Dionysus, Freya, Freyr, Geb, Hachiman, Isis, Osiris, Quetzalcoátl, Sif, Sobek, Tlaloc, Xipe Totec

GREEN_THUMB.NAME: GREEN THUMB
GREEN_THUMB.DESCRIPTION: The Scion need only touch a large plant (like a tree or bush) or a square yard patch of smaller plants (from a window box of daisies to a layer of algae) and spend a Legend point. That plant or patch can then survive for a full year (or for its entire life, if its natural duration is shorter) without food, sunlight, or water. The Scion's ministrations keep the plant healthy through drought, nutrient deficiency, unnatural darkness, or other environmental scarcity. The plant's environment must be within its natural tolerances for the plant to survive, however. (This Boon cannot nourish seaweed on the desert floor, for instance.) Furthermore, this Boon does not protect nor heal any blight or damage caused by herbivores.

CLEANSE.NAME: CLEANSE
CLEANSE.DESCRIPTION: Every gardener and farmer has to deal with pests or vermin sometimes, but doing so is easy for a Scion with this Boon. The player rolls (Stamina + Survival) and spends a Legend, and any blight or infestation ends immediately. The blight disappears as if it had never occurred, and vermin suddenly find the affected plants unappealing. This Boon affects a number of large plants (or a number of square yards of a patch of smaller plants) equal to the successes obtained on the roll. This Boon does not protect against future pests and stops only the current generation of vermin infestation.

BLESS_OR_BLIGHT.NAME: BLESS OR BLIGHT
BLESS_OR_BLIGHT.DESCRIPTION:
With a blessing, the Scion protects a patch of land from all natural blights and vermin infestations for a year. Alternatively, she can curse the land with a blight that kills the plants within it immediately or makes them so attractive to vermin that the resulting infestation has the same effect. The Scion's player spends three Legend and rolls (Stamina + Survival). The number of successes she rolls determines how many acres she can affect with this power.
If a Scion wants to use one aspect of this Boon on a patch of land on which another Scion used the opposite aspect, a contested roll is required. Whoever gets more successes spreads their effect over the larger area, canceling the lesser effect.

FIRE.NAME: FIRE
FIRE.DESCRIPTION:
For sharing fire with humanity, Zeus punished the Titan Prometheus. However, it was never clear whether Prometheus intended to uplift humanity with his generosity or destroy it with an insidious and visionary act of sabotage.
Associated With: Hephaestus, Loki, Ogoun, Ptah

FIRE_IMMUNITY.NAME: FIRE IMMUNITY
FIRE_IMMUNITY.DESCRIPTION: The Scion suffers no damage from fire, he never has to worry about suffering smoke inhalation, and even the most intense heat is nothing more than a comforting warmth to him. This immunity remains in effect regardless of what substance is burning. However, it does not extend to his clothes or any item, except the Birthright through which he channels the Boon.

BOLSTER_FIRE.NAME: BOLSTER FIRE
BOLSTER_FIRE.DESCRIPTION:
Normally, fire needs oxygen to breathe and fuel to consume. With this Boon, a Scion removes both needs from a single flame for one scene. He could keep a single torch (or even a match) lit for hours while exploring a dark labyrinth. He could make the tiny spark at the end of a fuse burn in place without moving. This Boon is also good for preventing a flame source from consuming breathable air in an enclosed space.
The Scion must be able to see the flame he intends to bolster, but once he uses the Boon, he can leave its presence without canceling the effect. The fire he bolsters with this Boon cannot be larger than that of an average campfire (about a meter in diameter).
If no flame source is available, the Scion can create a fire the size of a candle flame out of thin air. It burns at the tip of his finger or from some point on the Birthright he uses to activate the Boon. The flame is not strong enough to cause damage in combat, but can ignite a flammable substance easily.

FIRES_EYE.NAME: FIRE’S EYE
FIRES_EYE.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can see through any fire that A.) is already within his line of sight or B.) he has affected with Bolster Fire. The Scion cannot hear what is happening around a distant fire, and his field of vision remains the same through the fire as it is through his eyes. He can physically move his head or turn his body in place to change his remote perspective, however.
While he looks through the fire, the Scion cannot see from his own perspective. He can maintain his remote perspective for as long as he wishes.

GUARDIAN.NAME: GUARDIAN
GUARDIAN.DESCRIPTION:
It is the responsibility of every God and Scion to protect the World, but some take that duty more seriously than their fellows. It is from them that this Purview springs.
Associated With: Anubis, Baldur, Erzulie, Hachiman, Heimdall, Huitzilopochtli, Isis, Miclántecuhtli, Quetzalcoátl, Raiden, Set, Thor, Xipe Totec

VIGIL_BRAND.NAME: VIGIL BRAND
VIGIL_BRAND.DESCRIPTION: The Scion touches a person, an object, or the entrance to a location and places a mystical mark there that signals that subject as being under her protection. (Doing so costs one Legend.) From then on, whenever that subject is in physical danger (as determined by the Storyteller), the Scion receives a reflexive intuition to that effect. If her player then succeeds on a (Perception + Empathy) roll, she gains a clearer understanding of the subject's condition, location, and current situation. The Scion can also use this Boon to check on a subject at any time, but only one subject at a time. A Scion cannot mark herself with this Boon, but she can mark as many other subjects as she wishes. A subject can be marked by more than one Scion at the same time. Each mark is unique to the Scion who made it.

AEGIS.NAME: AEGIS
AEGIS.DESCRIPTION: By touching a mortal or an object, the Scion grants it a measure of divine physical protection. Her player spends a Legend and Willpower, and then rolls (Stamina + Fortitude), adding her usual bonuses. The successes on this roll apply to the subject of the Scion's protection as a temporary Hardness rating for the next 24 hours.

WARD.NAME: WARD
WARD.DESCRIPTION:
By touching the entrance to a location, the Scion places a ward on the area that bars entry to a certain type of threat. Such a ward could bar ghosts, undead, a breed of titanspawn, human beings, smaller animals, or Scions. The ward acts as a sphere with a circumference area equal to 500 square feet per Legend point the Scion possesses. It lasts for one day per success obtained by the (Stamina + Fortitude) roll.
The Scion can ward an area against as many different types of threats as she wants, but each threat requires its own activation roll and expenditure. (In effect, she must stack multiple wards on the same area.) Characters with more Legend than the Scion who placed the ward can attempt to force their way through the perimeter, thereby destroying the ward. The ward can take a number of health levels of damage equal to ([Scion's Legend x 5] + [activation roll successes]), and has a Hardness rating equal to the Scion's Legend.

HEALTH.NAME: HEALTH
HEALTH.DESCRIPTION:
This Purview concerns the physical well-being of beasts, mortals, or other Scions. Titanspawn and supernatural creatures are also legitimate subjects of these Boons, but a Scion cannot use these Boons on himself.
Associated With: Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Baron Samedi, Damballa, Freya, Freyr, Hera, Isis, Quetzalcoátl, Tlaloc, Xipe Totec

ASSESS_HEALTH.NAME: ASSESS HEALTH
ASSESS_HEALTH.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can instantly and automatically assess the current medical condition of a single living patient in his presence. He can tell how many levels of damage the patient is suffering, as well as any physical addictions they suffer, any diseases or illnesses they are infected with, and any genetic defects afflicting them.

BLESSING_OF_HEALTH_OR_CURSE_OF_FRAILTY.NAME: BLESSING OF HEALTH | CURSE OF FRAILTY
BLESSING_OF_HEALTH_OR_CURSE_OF_FRAILTY.DESCRIPTION:
The Boon can strip a patient's reproductive capabilities or restore them, provided the patient already has all the necessary organs. This effect lasts one year per success on the activation roll.
Used on a pregnant patient, the Boon can cause her unborn child to come into the World strong and healthy or sickly and deformed. The Boon can cure or create any of the following conditions: a physical deformity, a life-threatening birth defect, a chemical dependency, a disease contracted from the mother, physical damage suffered in the womb, or an unspecified effect on the immune system (representing a ±2 dice modifier on rolls to resist disease). Each separate condition raises the difficulty of the roll by one. A Scion can also use this Boon on an infant within the first 24 hours of its birth.

HEAL_OR_INFECT.NAME: HEAL | INFECT
HEAL_OR_INFECT.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion can repair a patient's wounds or inflict damage directly. On one hand, he can heal as many health levels of bashing damage as his player obtains successes on a (Stamina + Medicine) roll. Doing so costs one Legend. Alternatively, he can downgrade a number of health levels equal to successes on the roll from lethal damage to bashing damage. Doing so costs one Willpower.
On the other hand, he can inflict as many health levels of bashing damage as his player obtains successes on the (Stamina + Medicine) roll. Doing so also costs one Legend. Alternatively, he can upgrade a number of health levels equal to successes on the roll from bashing damage to lethal damage. Doing so costs one Willpower. The Scion can use this Boon on the same person only once per day. He can use it on as many different people in the same day as he can afford to spend the points.

JUSTICE.NAME: JUSTICE
JUSTICE.DESCRIPTION:
The Purview of Justice covers all forms of redress for slights, from the pettiest vengeance to the most grandiloquent karmic poetry.
Associated With: Anubis, Athena, Geb, Horus, Osiris, Quetzalcoátl, Shango, Thoth, Tyr, Vidar, Zeus

JUDGMENT.NAME: JUDGMENT
JUDGMENT.DESCRIPTION: This Boon immensely helps a Scion determine guilt, one of the foundations of applying justice. When she confronts someone she suspects of having committed an injustice and accuses that person of having done so, her player rolls (Perception + Empathy). (This roll is not modified by supernatural powers or contested by the suspect's player.) On a success, the Scion can intuitively tell if the suspect is guilty as charged. A failure produces an indeterminate reading and means the Scion cannot attempt to determine the guilt of the same subject for 24 hours. A botch produces a false reading.

GUILT_APPARITIONS.NAME: GUILT APPARITIONS
GUILT_APPARITIONS.DESCRIPTION:
When a Scion knows someone is guilty of an injustice but lacks the evidence to prove it or the leverage to make them admit it, she can rely on this Boon. To use it, she accuses the guilty party of the injustice (be it in person, in a letter, over the phone, via skywriting…), and her player spends a Legend point and rolls (Manipulation + Integrity). If the roll is successful, the accusation causes the victim to hallucinate periodically like Macbeth or his wife. These hallucinations occur randomly, torturing the guilty party with the knowledge that justice has not been done. They also make him unable to regain Willpower.
The effect lasts a number of days equal to the successes of the activation roll, or until the offender makes just reparations, or until the offender confesses his crime to someone who can force him to make just reparations — whichever comes first.

SHIELD_OF_RIGHTEOUSNESS.NAME: SHIELD OF RIGHTEOUSNESS
SHIELD_OF_RIGHTEOUSNESS.DESCRIPTION: This Boon can protect an innocent victim from suffering punishment due to someone else. The Scion cries out against the injustice — a simple “He didn't do it!” will suffice — and spends the Legend point and Willpower. By doing so, she renders the next action that would inflict damage on the innocent victim completely impotent, obviating any damage that action should inflict. Whether the victim is being stabbed by a jealous wife, shot by a firing squad, lynched by a mob, thrown off a cliff by a deluded vigilante Scion, or whatever, he suffers no harm from that action. For the Boon to work, the Scion must be present at the site of the unjust punishment, and the victim must truly be innocent.

MOON.NAME: MOON
MOON.DESCRIPTION:
This Purview represents the tidal effects of the moon, its ever-changing nature, and its celestial serenity.
Associated With: Artemis, Bastet, Horus, Kalfu, Tezcatlipoca, Thoth, Tsuki-yomi

SMOKING_MIRROR.NAME: SMOKING MIRROR
SMOKING_MIRROR.DESCRIPTION: Looking at the moon and spending the necessary Legend point, the character sees reflected in it an aerial view of the surrounding terrain. This perspective allows a clear view of a radius in miles equal to the Scion's Legend. The Scion can focus on any point in the reflection and see it clearly, but cannot see through physical objects or change the angle of the perspective from top-down. This Boon does not work on nights of the new moon, but can see through thick clouds on any other night. If the moon is visible during the day, the Scion can use this Boon as well.

TIDAL_INTERFERENCE.NAME: TIDAL INTERFERENCE
TIDAL_INTERFERENCE.DESCRIPTION: The Scion exerts a pull on all enemies with whom he is in melee combat. A success on a (Strength + Presence) roll activates this Boon, and the Scion spends a set number of Legend points (the maximum that can be spent is the Scion's permanent Legend value). The Boon then inflicts a DV penalty on his melee opponents equal to the number of Legend points he spent. This effect lasts for the remainder of the combat scene.

PHASE_CLOAK.NAME: PHASE CLOAK
PHASE_CLOAK.DESCRIPTION:
The Scion turns away from his enemies, just as the moon turns its face away from the earth. The player decides which “phase” of the character's body he wishes to leave visible and then rolls the Scion's (Dexterity + Stealth) against a difficulty determined on the following table. If the roll succeeds, the intended part of his body disappears from view. If the roll fails, the Legend point is still spent, but nothing happens. If the roll is a botch, the character assumes the full moon phase, taking a -3 penalty on any mundane attempt to hide.
A character can attempt to use this Boon only once per scene, and the effects last for the entire scene.
PhaseDifficultyEffect
Gibbous1Stealth rolls receive two bonus successes
Quarter2Stealth rolls receive four bonus successes
Crescent3Stealth rolls receive six bonus successes
New4Mundane detection attempts fail automatically. Stealth rolls against supernatural detection receive eight bonus successes
FullBotchStealth dice pools suffer a -3 penalty

PSYCHOPOMP.NAME: PSYCHOPOMP
PSYCHOPOMP.DESCRIPTION:
The Psychopomp Purview comprises all aspects of guiding subjects from one place to another, whether the destination is across town or in the deepest pits of the Underworld, and whether those subjects are dead souls or preschoolers.
Associated With: Baron Samedi, Hermes, Izanagi, Legba, Odin, Ptah, Quetzalcoátl, Susano-o, Tsuki-yomi

UNERRING_ORIENTATION.NAME: UNERRING ORIENTATION
UNERRING_ORIENTATION.DESCRIPTION:
In a place she knows well, like her hometown or a national park she visits every autumn, the Scion knows how to get from any point inside it to any other point. In an unfamiliar place, her sense of direction defaults to a compass rose. If someone gives her correct directions in an unfamiliar place, she retains them from then on. If she studies a map of an unknown city for five minutes, that information stays imprinted in her mind until she leaves that city for more than a week.
For the cost of one Legend, the Boon can also reveal to a Scion how far away and in what direction the place she considers home lies. Alternatively, if the Scion finds herself in a strange place — if she has been drugged and kidnapped, for example — this Boon can tell her how far she is and in what direction she has traveled since the last place where she was not lost.

WHERE_ARE_YOU.NAME: WHERE ARE YOU?
WHERE_ARE_YOU.DESCRIPTION: If someone makes remote contact with a Scion (by phone, instant message, telepathy…), the Scion has a sense of how far away they are and in what direction. She may not be able to direct the person to her location, but she can follow her instinct straight to the location where the contact originated. The sensation remains even after the contact period ends, but does not follow the person if that person moves. It can only lead a Scion to where communication ended.

UNBARRED_ENTRY.NAME: UNBARRED ENTRY
UNBARRED_ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: The Scion can pass through a solid surface as if she or the surface were intangible. She can pass through only as much space as she could cross in a single step — through a wall or a locked door, for example — and doing so is a simple action. All the Scion's clothes and items transition with her, but she cannot pull anyone else behind. If the solid surface is too thick for her to step through, it remains as solid for her as for everyone else. This Boon does not make the Scion literally intangible, however, so she cannot use it in combat to avoid damage or to pass through a ring of fire without getting burned.

SKY.NAME: SKY
SKY.DESCRIPTION:
The Sky Purview is one of wind, storms, lightning, and flight. Its Boons offer a Scion unmatched freedom and majesty.
Associated With: Frigg, Horus, Izanagi, Quetzalcoátl, Raiden, Set, Shango, Susano-o, Thor, Tlaloc, Zeus

SKYS_GRACE.NAME: SKY’S GRACE
SKYS_GRACE.DESCRIPTION:
By spending a Legend point, the Scion suffers no damage from falls of any height. Alternatively, the Scion can use that point to double the distance he can jump both straight up and horizontally. If the Scion has the Holy Bound Knack — see p. 126 — as well as this Boon, the base distance he can jump doubles, and then doubles again if the player spends a Legend point.
Furthermore, Sky’s Grace can mitigate the knockback the character suffers from successful attacks. If an attack pushes the character backward, he can spend a Legend point to stop in a sudden gust of wind. The attack still pushes the character back at least one meter, but the character can stop at any distance he chooses beyond that.

WINDS_FREEDOM.NAME: WIND’S FREEDOM
WINDS_FREEDOM.DESCRIPTION: The Scion laughs in the face of gravity. For the rest of the scene, the distances the Scion can move or dash per action remain normal, but now apply to the Z-axis as well as the X and Y axes. All normal rules for movement remain in effect, except that the character can now move freely through three dimensions (i.e., he can fly). He can even stand still in the air if he wants. The only thing a character cannot do in the air that he could do on the ground is jump, as there is nothing to jump from. If the character lets go of the Birthright that makes this Boon possible or allows it to be destroyed, the effect ends immediately.

STORM_AUGMENTATION.NAME: STORM AUGMENTATION
STORM_AUGMENTATION.DESCRIPTION: For a number of actions equal to the successes the player rolled to activate the Boon, jagged strands of lightning coil around the Scion's fists or weapon, or howling winds sweep around him as he moves. On any successful attack he makes in the subsequent duration, he can spend a Legend point to make thunder crack or winds blow violently. Doing so automatically doubles any knockback the attack applies. Additionally, if the attack inflicts even one level of damage, have the victim's player roll (Stamina + Fortitude) against a difficulty equal to (raw damage – victim's Legend).
